result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge, filed by Atty. Lutgen.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services following program protocol for those that are low risk, unless otherwise ordered by the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring.  Defendant to report to WCS within one business day from today for installation of the CAM monitor.    Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is allowed to have capentary tools.

08:34 AM Defendant Adam M Karweik in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appearing in court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Victim A makes a statement.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
